stadium.name: The Buccaneer's Bowl
stadium.description: A flashy, pristine stadium built on a private beach exclusively for resort guests. The field is imported turf, and a massive, puppet kraken in the bay entertains the crowd at halftime.

stats.pregame_ritual: Slapping their own helmet until their ears ring.
Sticking leeches to their legs to 'lighten their step'.
Bribing a local oracle with a meat pie for a vague prophecy.
Reviewing hand signals for secret plays.
Reading their own fortune in a scattering of knuckle bones.
Thanking their armor for the protection it's about to offer.
Painting their teeth with a mixture of charcoal and water.
Doing a series of loud, guttural breathing exercises.
Reciting their grocery list backward to clear their mind.
Clapping their hands a prime number of times.
Chugging a raw egg, shell and all.
Sticking leeches to their legs to 'lighten their step'.

stadium.name: The Cliffside Pitch
stadium.description: A perilous, windswept field built next to the town's lighthouse. There is no ocean-side barrier, and the wind is notoriously unpredictable. The tusk-like lighthouse is the only landmark.

stats.pregame_ritual: Telling each other exaggerated lies about their own strength.
Stretching their hamstrings for exactly seven minutes.
Rubbing the Trollball on their armpits for 'grip'.
Arranging their gear in a perfect, aesthetically pleasing spiral.
Adjusting their codpiece with theatrical importance.
Getting a teammate to pour a bucket of cold water over their head.
Muttering a nonsensical rhyme to ward off bad spirits.
Filing down a single fingernail into a sharp point.
Giving the Trollball a heroic backstory before each game.
Listening to the wind for a sign of which way the game will turn.
Wearing a necklace of polished river stones.
Adjusting their codpiece with theatrical importance.
Muttering a nonsensical rhyme to ward off bad spirits.
Filing down a single fingernail into a sharp point.
Wearing a necklace of polished river stones.
Rubbing the Trollball on their armpits for 'grip'.
Arranging their gear in a perfect, aesthetically pleasing spiral.
Stretching their hamstrings for exactly seven minutes.
Getting a teammate to pour a bucket of cold water over their head.
Listening to the wind for a sign of which way the game will turn.

preGame: Hooo-eee! Step right up, sports fans! It's a gorgeous, blood-soaked Tuesday night in the Everwar, and we are coming to you live from the Buccaneer’s Bowl on Toast Island! I'm your host, Nok the Corrupter, and boy, do we have a doozy for the Losers Bracket! It’s win or go home—well, you don't really 'go home' in Osterra, you just respawn and try again, but you get the sentiment! We've got a Best of 3 series starting right here, and the atmosphere is thicker than the fog in a demon prison! The Southport Narwhals are looking to poke some holes today, led by Crescint Sonia who I hear has filed a single fingernail into a deadly point just for the occasion! Talk about dedication to the craft! I also caught Torey Dannye whispering to the sea breeze; let's hope the wind whispers back something better than 'you're going to lose,' ha! Across the field, the Tortell Privateers are looking flashy under that blinding sun. These guys are local favorites here at the resort, and I saw Dib Tufts chugging a raw egg, shell and all, earlier! That’s the kind of stomach-turning grit that makes Trollball the greatest game on any plane! Even if my beloved Ebon Gate Corruptors aren't on the pitch today, I can smell the desperation of the losers bracket in the air, and it smells like... well, it smells like sweaty tourists and sunscreen! The Buccaneer's Bowl is packed with distracted tourists who probably think this is all part of the dinner show, but they’re about to see more red than a sunset on the Styx! Let’s get to the carnage!
postGame: What a glorious display of carnage we witnessed today in Game 1 of this series! The Tortell Privateers have drawn first blood, taking a 1 to 0 lead over the Southport Narwhals in a defensive masterclass that would make even the most stone-faced Warden weep with joy! The action kicked off with a bang when Kidder Starkey absolutely leveled Blanc Fantasia early on, sending them straight to the healer’s tent with an injury that surely hurt worse than one of Sir Tanos' boring speeches! Speaking of 'heroes,' I didn't see many in the stands today, probably because they're too busy having tea with Maple or counting their coins like that kissless virgin Brennen Farno! The Narwhals tried to establish a rhythm, but the blinding sun of Toast Island seemed to have them squinting more than a bat in a lighthouse! Loralyn Lyndy had a rough go of it, throwing a wild pass that went nowhere, much like the career of a Haven Light! But the Privateers weren't much better at first, with Goldberg Tova and Castorina Gies dropping the ball like it was a cursed artifact from Geth's collection! It was a real scramble in center field, a beautiful mess of failed tackles and heavy breathing that kept the fans—well, the three of them that weren't looking at the puppet kraken—on the edge of their seats! Then came the moment of the match! Castorina Gies found a gap in the defense, zipped a beauty of a pass to Lilithe Royce in the End Zone, and BOOM! A touchdown dunk that put the Privateers on the board! The crowd went wild, or at least the resort security did while they were busy tossing out a few rowdy fans! Halftime gave everyone a chance to scrape their teeth off the turf, and the Narwhals came back looking for revenge! Blood Eppes showed some real spark, snatching an interception out of the air like a hungry harpy, but the Privateer defense was as solid as Chairman Ironrock's favorite door! The injuries started piling up faster than unpaid tabs at Imra’s bar! Keisling Damalas and Ellan Elburt were handing out bruises like party favors, sending Blood Eppes and Torey Dannye to the sidelines! It was a symphony of violence, a real Tuesday night treat! Even with the Narwhals trying to rally late, Loralyn Lyndy’s desperation pass was intercepted by Ellan Elburt, effectively slamming the door on any comeback hopes! It’s a tough break for the Southport crew, but that's the playoffs for you; one mistake and you're fish food! I haven't seen this many people stumbling around since the last time I saw Pirate Prince Rory at an open bar! The Privateers take the win, 1-0, and the Narwhals have their backs against the wall heading into Game 2! If they want to stay in this bracket, they better find a way to stop the bleeding—literally! This is Nok the Corrupter signing off from the Buccaneer's Bowl, reminding you that in Trollball, if you aren't bleeding, you aren't trying! Goodnight, Osterra!
